website_summaries.verdict: A classic Clarks boot that will always look good.
pros: A timeless look that hasn't changed in 50 years
These Clarks are weather-resistant and make for great everyday wear
Available in suede or leather in a variety of colors
cons: Many customers noted that these will take some time to break in

customer_reviews.title: Amazon website Vs. Clark's website product differences
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two pairs of these Beeswax Clark's Original Desert Boots from two different websites for comparison. One from Amazon, and one from the Clark's website. There are noticeable differences between the two. (SEE PHOTOS) The pair I ordered through Amazon (on the left) are made of thinner, less quality leather. The ones from Clark's (on the right) are a much beefier, thicker leather with a higher quality grain and have more of a "real leather boot" feel. Whereas the ones from Amazon feel somewhat like cheap knockoffs in comparison. They are still a decent shoe for the price. But compared to the ones from Clark's they seem much flimsier.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Mortenson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed is an understatement
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe the condition these shoes arrived in. In the attached pictures you can see what I ordered vs what I received. Very, very disappointed. Do not buy these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Moore

customer_reviews.title: Found some amazing deal on Amazon for $34
customer_reviews.text: They were brand new in box. Seller was rated well and the price was seemingly too good to be true but since it was Prime I went for it. Couldn't be happier with $120 boots for $34. CDB's are a classic. They're well made and super comfortable. They do not like wet linoleum or other smooth surfaces though.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Versatile, Good Looking
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these boots for five years, and I've always been happy with them. They look good with jeans or khakis, and have suited me for trudges through unexpected snow as well as family dinners. The key to keeping them versatile for work or dressier looks is to care for them with a good mink oil leather protector, and cedar she trees are also helpful. I've not yet had to replace the crepe sole, and the threads are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Cox

customer_reviews.title: Shoes had scratches and paint on them
customer_reviews.text: I bought Clark's in the green color. I am unfortunately unable to tell you how they feel after wearing them since I sent them back but they fit as expected. The color is exactly as pictured. The shoes I received had paint on them and huge scratches. The photos might help you though.
customer_reviews.author: N. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fine boot
customer_reviews.text: Personal preference, I'd have preferred if there were another set of eyelets so you could tie the laces up just a bit more. They currently tighten above the middle of my foot, which works but when i walk my heel lifts up before the rest of the shoe (if that makes sense). Fine boot otherwise. Maybe if I got a 9 instead of a 9.5 (US) but then maybe the toes would be too tight. CLARKS knows how to make good footwear though, the quality of the boot is as you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: NeilS

customer_reviews.title: Should have paid Attention
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10 in every other shoe and sneaker I own. These boots are so badly designed and executed that, when I decided to try them on for a second time this week, I just gave up. I doubt that I will ever wear them again (only wore them once with much discomfort). I read reviews about the boots being small and ordering a size larger, but I’m uncomfortable doing that. I should have paid attention. That said, these are really not good looking Chukka boots either - leaves a lot to be desired. And they are expensive as well. Huge disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Brian McClafferty

customer_reviews.title: I am honestly surprised with how painful the tongue is on these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am honestly surprised with how painful the tongue is on these shoes. They look nice but I have a pair of Steve Maddens that I get far more compliments on. The Desert Boots are obviously a staple of the malefashionadvice subreddit, however I don't find myself wearing these nearly as often as my other shoes/boots. The fit is completely asinine... You will have to order at least a size down, possibly a size and a half. I usually wear a 10 or 10.5 in running shoes, 10 in dress shoes, and I would probably do best with an 8.5 or 9 size in the Desert Boots.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: These Clarks runs small
customer_reviews.text: My husband has narrow feet, has no trouble getting shoes to fit. My feet are a bit wider and all the Clarks I've tried run narrow & small. I was surprised he found these to be small, I assumed they would be just right for him. However, his description is exactly what happened to me - he tries to put his foot in and his foot gets strangled, there is not enough room to insert his foot in comfortably, the top presses down way too much, making it very hard to even put on. Very disappointed and had to return.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. MillerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Fit!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful shoe and, if I could get my foot into it, it would get five stars. I've have had Clarks before and expect to break them in especially since I have a wide foot. However the cut across the instep is so tight that I cannot even get my foot into the shoe. My current pair was made in China and fit perfectly; this pair was made in Vietnam and doesn't fit at all. Unfortunately, I was on business travel when these came in and now I've missed the return window. Maybe I can hang them from my rear view mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Lonesome George, RIP

customer_reviews.title: Amazon advertised these as Clarks desert boots.
customer_reviews.text: These are not Clarks desert boots. They are Clark desert boots in like but are from a company called supply lab
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clarks, Please read and comment,
customer_reviews.text: I love CLARKS period. These are fantastic time proven shoes. But.. If I was in charge of making these shoes, I would implement these changes. 1. There is no arch support. I purchased footbeds for my pair, for extra support(actually support since there is none) 2. Gum Soles are to thin on the front of these shoes. IMO Clarks should double the thickness. ( I noticed this while climbing ladders and stairs) 3. Add 1 more set of eyelets. Don't get me wrong, these are great shoes but if these changes were made, they would be perfect. IMO Tell me what all of you think?
customer_reviews.author: TheAv8er

customer_reviews.title: Honest and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are simple, tough and comfortable boots. They are very well made and quality materials are used in all parts of the boot. Be aware that they are definitely not work boots, though they would be fine for light work in the garden and around the house. They are primarily casual footwear that go well with chinos, jeans casual pants of most colors and even shorts. The great thing about them is that they are comfortable straight out of the box and become more so as the leather softens. I recommend the use of silicone protector spray for suede - this will prevent spots and marks from liquid spills and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: John Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, minimal break in
customer_reviews.text: Normally with Clarks you'll have to go down 1/2 to 1 full size but these fit as expected. For reference in New Balance I wear a size 8 1/2 and in Nike a size 9. In other Clarks desert boots a size 8 but with these I wear an 8 1/2. Beeswax Leather Clarks are thick and take time to break in, where these rust leather ones break in quickly but still great quality leather. Gum soles are more comfortable than the others but get dirty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Sizing / Product Description
customer_reviews.text: The price was the cheapest I've seen for Veg Leather shoes. They're usually >$200, but got these at $60 and made in Italy. On Clarks, you need to size down one from your sneaker size and the shoe will accommodate you. Big issue was the product description of "Natural Tan" and some pictures. That can mean a lot like suede or beeswax finishes, but the product did match the pictures and delivery as expected, so am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots. Very high quality, very comfortable, look sharp, great price. Just perfect.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are just great and for the price they are just about unbeatable. I personally prefer the classic beeswax leather model, but the suede ones look pretty sharp too. I seem to be coming back to these boots time after time, having tried in between just about everything from the indestructible Red Wing to the unparalleled Ferragamo to the ubiquitous Ken Cole. These Clarks may not be as sturdy as the Red Wing, or as amazing (and expensive) as Salvatore's beauties, but given the combination of their high quality, great looks, amazing comfort, and unbelievable price, they are pretty much my all time favorites. Many thanks.
customer_reviews.author: AZOT

customer_reviews.title: THE Classic Chukka Boot
customer_reviews.text: Simple, fairly light weight, quite comfortable. Personally I'd like a little more arch support but adding a quality insole allows me to wear them all day and still take a two mile trail walk in the evening. I never have that feeling that "I gotta get out of these shoes." This classic chukka boot has been around forever because it's close to perfect. If you shop carefully you'll find some colors at incredible discounts. I paid about $55 for my latest pair Even at the typical price of $90 to $130 they represent good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Straw

customer_reviews.title: Not a good all purpose footwear
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an upgrade from my Madden Boots for all purpose footwear; casual wear, going to work, riding the motorcycle. These lasted about 3 months before the sole became a sticky melting mess that would collect hair, dirt, rocks, and all sorts of lovelies. The Madden lasted me about 3 years in comparison. I wouldn't recommend these, especially if you own a bike.
customer_reviews.author: q

customer_reviews.title: You gotta break em in
customer_reviews.text: The crepe sole is a nice touch, better than the bushacre hard rubber sole. I've had a pair for years. While the leather holds up and ages well, the crepe soul grinded down flat to the point where there's no more hell. These things hurt in the beginning but after a few weeks they become some of the most comfy boots ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Made with Horween leather that breaks in beautifully. Only one problem with this
customer_reviews.text: Made with Horween leather that breaks in beautifully. Only one problem with this: My pair fits a half size larger than marked. I have experience with Clark's desert boots size 10.5 and 11. This 10.5 is as long as my size 11. I have a size 10.5 beeswax desert boot and it's shorter than this 10.5 wine boot. It's hard to tell if this was a fluke or not. I would have sized down to 10 with this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Love the classic desert boot
customer_reviews.text: Love the desert boot. Got a very good deal on the Terracotta suede. It is a very muted red color, similar but not exactly like maroon. Good looking color, and a bit different. Styling is spot on, simple, rugged but elegant. No arch support, which is fine with me. These are Clarks Originals which means the design dates back to the '50s. They employ none of the modern techniques for making a shoe comfortable, but a suede upper and the crepe sole make for a very comfortable shoe which can be worn all day long. Runs a little large. A real good looking and comfortable classic. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: PAUL K

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little large, but looks so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a pair of CDB's for ages and I finally got them! The leather WILL crease and scuff, so be prepared for that. Some people prefer the worn look. I've been applying some leather conditioner every so often and that's helped. It does seem to run a little large, but not so much as to be uncomfortable. You should probably go half a size smaller than you normally are. I don't really care for the crepe sole, it's practically black at this point and I'm sure it'll wear down in about a year. They look great though, and as a budget boot I don't think they can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: The customer service is fantastic. However
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes as a gift for my dad. I ordered a size to big by accident and notified the company, and they shipped me one of the correct size so quickly. The customer service is fantastic. However, he was so excited that he just put on the shoes and after we figured out that the shoes were a little too small, they were too dirty to try to exchange. And the company had already helped me in getting them shipped to me so quickly that I felt embarrassed asking them for help again. My dad still loves the shoes, and so do I (I have them too!) but unfortunately he can't wear them for too long. :(
customer_reviews.author: sophia

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: My son liked the boot, but it ran too big and slid up his heel. I read the reviews and bough a whole size down, but ended up returning for an even smaller size. I would recommend 1 whole size if you plan on wearing thick socks, if not go a whole size and a half down.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer anderson

customer_reviews.title: Looks really good, needs some breaking in when initially worn
customer_reviews.text: Looks really good, needs some breaking in when initially worn. My biggest problem with the shoes is the soles and eyelets for the laces. First, the soles, I feel like I am walking on eraser rubber. I see the edges around shoes fray as if it was an eraser and am concerned as to how long the sole will last. Secondly, the eyelets, on my pair, the left shoe's left side, upper, eyelet was not put in properly and actually comes off. Full star deducted for the eyelets and a half star deducted for the sole as my fears aren't quite realized yet. Also the color of the learther seems to fade rather quickl. Another half star.
customer_reviews.author: Lichie

customer_reviews.title: KISS
customer_reviews.text: It’s simple design really does take care of the basics of good footwear. They’re comfortable with no hot spots or pinch points. Scuff’em? Just wipe with your finger and it disappears. Outstanding
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth O. Klumb

customer_reviews.title: Great looking comfortable boot!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered down as everyone else said - and very happy for it. For reference, I wear a 11-12 US mens sneaker, and typically around a 10.5 dress shoe. I ordered the 10.5 and they are PERFECT! So all in all - if you are unsure - cheat towards what you wear in a dress shoe rather than a sneaker. These are GREAT boots - man do I love them already! After a brief break in period, I could wear them all day. The sole is quiet - and I imagine it will wear out fairly quickly, but I don't think the "original" boot was designed for pounding the pavement.
customer_reviews.author: pcpeggs

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY SMALL. Thin and flimsy upper leather. Most uncomfortable Clark's owned.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in the fit. I have two other pairs of Clark's desert boots in this same size but they actually fit perfectly. These boots fit too small. They are too tight at the toes and it feels like the crease the shoe crushes your foot with each step. I couldn't go more than 10 steps when I tried them on. Breaking in the shoes would have left my feet bruised and bloodied. Also, the "crepe soles" don't feel as soft and comfortable as my previous crepe sole Clark's. The shoe feels like cheap quality, the upper leather is extremely thin and flimsy. Really regret buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should own a pair.
customer_reviews.text: These are just wonderful shoes. The Desert Boot is classic and have remained unchanged for a long time. The crepe sole will wear out. Mine typically last about 1-2 years and thats wearing them almost everyday. They are extremely comfortable after break in. They get good traction in everything except ice thanks to the softness of the sole. They look splendid with all sorts of clothing (at least the original color does). Clark's Desert Boots are a mainstay in my closet. After they wear out you get another pair. The only thing that could make these better would be if they were still made in England instead of Vietnam
customer_reviews.author: James Gallacher

customer_reviews.title: good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: this is my first time ordering / using a desert boot like Clarks so i'm not too sure what to expect or it is normal. from the reviews people said to order a size 1/2 smaller because they expand after they are broken in. I guess i have a ways to go because they are still pretty narrow. the show itself is a good quality boot. its just the size thing that you will need to get down. Also what's with the bottom sole of the boot? it looks like packing foam nothing tough enough to stand up to walking on concrete or pavement but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: darizo99

customer_reviews.title: Love it...!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Looks good with jeans. Can also be worn for professional business look. Have gotten a lot of complements. Like them so much, that I purchased a 2nd pair of the same color. In the beginning, walking in them felt a little bit RAW. Put insoles in and all good. Definitely recommend these for all occasions. They are my go-to shoes now.
customer_reviews.author: Gorilla Millionaire

customer_reviews.title: My first Clarks shoe is quality
customer_reviews.text: Would recommend buying your size. My feet are on the wide size so I bought a 11.5 even though i wear 11. It turns out that it is a bit wider than i would like. The shoe however is pure quality. Had positive comments from males and females. Will get myself a wallabee soon.well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Omaro Spence

customer_reviews.title: Been a life long Clark's fan, but the quality has gone down hill...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Clarks for over 20 years and this will be my last pair. The soles of these are much more cheaply made than all my previous Clarks. After 1 week the bottom layer of the soles came apart and no longer even wear them. These were also much more narrow than any Clark's I've purchased before and the leather would not loosen to fit my foot. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for every occasion.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these shoes! Bought them for San Fransisco in the winter and they have worked out perfect. They are not waterproof but do a good job staying dry and so far have held up really well. The leather was soft from day one and didn't take anytime to break in. Love the fit and feel of them. Get plenty of positive compliments on them too. Highly recommend! Only wish I would have gone even smaller. Need to order at least a size down maybe a size and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Jono Slade

customer_reviews.title: Looks good. Not yet comfortable or 100% practical.
customer_reviews.text: They are stylish and go with anything. However, I order small, knowing they run big. I ordered a full size small and they fit as well as the size I normally wear. The leather is very stiff, and requires what I assume to be a week-two week break-in period. I'm on day three and do not wear them repetitively. The sole is nice and quiet when walking on hard floors, however, deteriorates faster than I would have hoped. (I am not a dragger, nor do I walk with a swagger that would inhibit the longevity of the shoe.)
customer_reviews.author: Keith R.

customer_reviews.title: Classic, not enough room for arch support inserts.
customer_reviews.text: The Clark's Desert Boot is a classic. I got the Beeswax finish. They are some of my favorite shoes. They can be a bit warm on the feet. Quiet sole. Love them. Update: These shoes can be a bit tight over the top of your foot. Sometimes they hurt a little. And they have very little arch support. Essentially none. Still great shoes. But if you need to insert orthopedic arch supports you will need a whole size larger shoe. At least I suspect that would work. If I put inserts in mine the shoe becomes too tight from top to bottom and then hurts across the top of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes, but a couple things make it "just good" rather than "great." 1. The laces placement is too far toward the toe, which causes my heals to float some. 2. There is little arch support. Not too much of an issue in-and-of itself, but coupled with the floating heal, the shoe isn't as comfortable as Clark models I've had in the past. That being said, I wore the shoes for about 7 hours yesterday without obvious discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph  Spada

customer_reviews.title: Sole doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are more like slippers. They are very comfy around the house, maybe even in the office, but they just don't hold up to the outdoors. The crepe sole wears out very quick and you will find yourself getting them resoled or just throwing them out after 100 or so days of regular use. It also provides little support if you are using them for outdoor shoes. As the sole wears it starts breaking apart and picks up all kinds of hair. The leather isn't the best quality, but it can hold up and you can keep it clean with proper cleaning and conditioning, I expect more for a "boot" at this price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, runs big
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for Christmas-he wears 10's in everything else FRYE shoes and UGG slippers for reference) but these boots were really quite large-about an inch too long. We are trying half a size down the second time around. Otherwise, really classy, not a lot of support, but that's typical of these types of shoes. One thing to note, it seems like the idea behind the shoe finish is to give them a nice worn look, you bend the toes once and it leaves a lighter mark around the crease. This is exactly the look my Husband likes, but if you want a clean, crisp boot, just be aware these may not be it!
customer_reviews.author: Zombiedottie

customer_reviews.title: I listened to everyone else and bought a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to everyone who commented on the sizing I bought my boots a size smaller and they fit perfectly! I love the color (beeswax) even though they are slightly darker than in the image. The boots are highly scuffable, yes I made up that word but it describes them perfectly. If you hit them in anyway you will leave a scuff mark but luckily the boots are like self-healing for majority of the light scratches just fade away but also gives the boots character. The gummy soles of the shoes make walking comfortable but could use a little more padding in the inside though. They were shipped relatively quick which was a definite plus but all over a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: dre

customer_reviews.title: May be in the market for other finishes
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of desert boots. I have worn the style in the past. The others I have worn did not seem to have the quality build I have found with Clarks. I have a damage knee that has been a part of my life for about one half century and Clarks is the first boot that provides the stable foot plant I need so that my knee doesn't feel squishy by the end of the day. I will most likely purchase several other pairs of these and I think I made REALLY good decision to start with the beeswax finish; they will age well and for people who like boots, this finish provides very nice "character".
customer_reviews.author: RayBlahBlah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing but know what you're getting into.
customer_reviews.text: In the first weeks, I was sure they were too small and I ordered a full size lower. Constant hurting on my heels, leaving my legs to be sore for hours after wearing. Had to order some heel cushions, which completely help. After about 2-3 weeks of wearing, they are the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. Perfect look for jeans. Pic related, mine after about two months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Comfortable And Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Comfortable, stylish, casual, perfect fit and great for Spring/Summer. Only problem, and this would apply for any light colored shoes, if you wear them with dark unwashed selvedge jeans the blue dye in the denim will discolor them. My Rag and Bone, and Nudie jeans, left a nice dark blue ring around the tops.
customer_reviews.author: kp001nh

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are fantastically comfortable and for the most part, very well made. My only complaints are minor: first, that the laces on one of them broke after four or five months, but they sent me a free replacement pair when I submitted the problem to their website. Second, they aren't as waterproof as you might think, so I spray them with polymer water repellent and that takes care of that. All around these shoes are classic looking, well made and comfortable. Though make sure that you get one size down from what you're used to (I'm normally a 10, so I bought a 9, which fits me perfectly).
customer_reviews.author: mfriedmann4

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes - flimsy soles
customer_reviews.text: The leather wears great. The soles are very comfortable and silent as a ninja. They wear very well. Some of the best I have ever owned. Edit: Feb 2015 After several months of wear, I would recommend the Clark's Bushacre instead if you are looking to wear the boot frequently. The crepe soles on the original clark's desert boot wear out very quickly and provide little structure to the shoe. The degradation of the soles eventually leaves the shoe looking loose, flimsy, and unprofessional. My wife has a pair of original crepe desert boots that she loves because she wears them occasionally and they have therefore held up well.
customer_reviews.author: William Sprite

customer_reviews.title: Casual but smart footwear. I was concerned about the soles being ...
customer_reviews.text: Casual but smart footwear. I was concerned about the soles being too slippery for icy conditions, but found the grip quite acceptable. The size I ordered was a hint too big, although that was my usual size, but I purchased heal inserts which solved the problem. I have always admired these boots so look forward wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: JGP

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes. They are really lightweight (comparable to my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. They are really lightweight (comparable to my Nikes) and, especially once broken in, are incredibly comfortable. They also don't overheat my feet like a lot of leather shoes, which is nice for Oklahoma summers. The only con is that the soles quickly turn black from walking around. I live in a small, non-pedestrian city - I think they'd look disgusting after a day walking around in a bigger city that relies on pedestrian traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: But I have faith they will be good The leather only took a day to soften up
customer_reviews.text: There are too new to rate definitively . But I have faith they will be good The leather only took a day to soften up. The bottom will turn black when outside looks ugly to me. I will take it to shoe repair place to add another lace hole. Very simple design , no Gor-tex always looks good to me like a good pair of gloves. People were talking about the fit being a size larger I do think that's true to a small degree. I usually wear an 11 in a shoe. So i bought the 10.5. Remember to size down a half size. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Mutant53

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boot
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 10.5 in shoes, so I figured the 10 would fit perfect and it did. I bought these boots about 5-6 months ago at this point and have worn them probably 95% of those days. It is a great all around boot, nice enough to wear to the office for work, yet can easily dress it up to be worn out, or dressed down for everyday wear. These boots are very comfortable and easy to maintain. I put some Sno-Seal on mine right away to make sure I didn't get any water or salt damage from the winter, and haven't had any issues. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a solid all-around comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.author: cbos09

customer_reviews.title: Buy a half size smaller
customer_reviews.text: The size 11 ran large, I have since bought a 10.5 and will see how they go. I'll likely review that purchase or update this one in a few weeks after I have broken them in. EDIT: The 10.5's fit like most of my size 11 shoes. So I would say this boot just runs a half size to big. The boots are comfortable enough to wear all day and in fact I do wear them all day. Moved my rating from 3 stars to 4.
customer_reviews.author: zootermop

customer_reviews.title: Best looking boots I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best looking pair of boots I have. I've been wearing them every other day for over a month. I've noticed no unusual wear or other flaws. The shoestrings appear to be a bit small and delicate for a boot, but they seem to be doing the job without fraying. The matte dark red/brown color oiled leather sets a perfect casual but upscale tone. They are comfortable, but don't have strong arch support. Easy to get on and off and they don't make your feet hot.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: TRUE TO SIZE
customer_reviews.text: after reading countless reviews that stated that these boots ran large by 1/2 to 1 size , I ordered a half size smaller. They were too small! I take a size 9 in everything and a size 9 is what fit in these boots. NOT a 8.5 like was recommended. I think people are confusing the loose ankle fit to being a size too large. This is the style of the boot. They are minimal in design, no interior padding. Sloppy on the ankle, secure in the middle, true to length. Expect this before buying. Comfort is 3 stars, style is 5. Not recommended for anyone who will stand all day.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Not at all happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I have serious doubts that these shoes are actually authentic Clarks. They dont fit to size which is not my usual experience with clarks. materials are not of the same quality. Paradise Shoes customer service is not at all friendly or accomodating.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Scott Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I returned them
customer_reviews.text: I caught these on sale for about $60 and almost kept them because of the incredible price. With that said, I usually wear a size 14 and that's what I ordered but they were just too big. I am not used to wearing boots so I don't know if it's a boot thing or they actually were too big, so I sent them back. Also, I feel I should note, in the short time I wore them around the house these would scuff very easily, especially where they bend when you walk. But I guess that's the point of boots, to have them roughed up and used looking
customer_reviews.author: The Santos's

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, one the brown suede, and the other the beeswax. Both are great! I wear the suede one for more formal wear but the beeswax is my go to shoe other than my sneakers. They are of course not as comfortable as sneakers but are comfortable in their own category. The beeswax looks better the more it wears. I wear it very frequently and it goes with almost anything casual that I wear. Water does leave marks on the suede so you do have to watch for that but I wear the suede too, just less frequently and with slightly more formal but casual outfit. Bottom line, great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: NIck Bond

customer_reviews.title: They're nice looking boots though
customer_reviews.text: As Amazon defines 3 stars.... it's ok. 2 sets of eyelets is not enough to provide ankle support for a boot. I can't walk around in it all day because it causes chaffing at my ankle bone. They're nice looking boots though, just not as functional as I would like. It's not like I'm asking it to help me hike up Half Dome, but with a name like Desert Boot, I would expect it to not cause any chaffing after a day of city walking. I guess that would explain why they're popular with men as fashion boots.
customer_reviews.author: TV

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of Clark's Originals and they fit like a glove, so I felt comfortable in ordering another pair. I couldn't find black suede in women's, so I found a conversion chart from men's to women's sizes. Initially, putting them on was the same comfortable feeling but when I started walking there was a painful, crushing across the top of both shoes just where the toes bend. Very painful. I didn't even make 100 steps before returning to the closet for some other shoes. Thats unfortunate,because I love my other chukka boots and get many compliments on them.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Me favorite boots.
customer_reviews.text: Order a size down and you'll be aite. These boots are very nice and the more you wear them out, the nicer they look in my opinion. Mine are going on 2 years and still look amazing and get complimented all the time. Cant beat that for the price you pay! PS. Be warned, you will bust your ass if you wear these in the rain or snow.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing versatile pair of boots. Better than the Bushacre 2
customer_reviews.text: Always buy a full size down on these boots and you wont be disappointed. These are way better than the Bushacre 2s. The sole lasts longer and is way more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking
customer_reviews.text: I wear a women's 11, I ordered a men's 9.5. I'm guessing they are basically the exact same shoe and the men's version was cheaper! I ordered the color Taupe Suede. I ordered these shoes to wear to work. I walk to work, about 1.25 miles each way, and I need a shoe that looks professional but is still comfortable enough to walk in and wear all day. These are perfect! They didn't require any breaking in, though I ordered the suede version rather than leather which might be stiffer. The color is slightly darker than the picture, but it's pretty similar.
customer_reviews.author: lampe3

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots; odd fit
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice boots but a somewhat awkward fit. Probably because they are based on an old-style they don't fit as well as modern boots. I usually wear a 10 1/2 wide. I ordered an 11 m. They are not offered in a wide width. It is definitely wide enough but probably a half size too long. Just wearing them around the house the gum soles picked up dark spots so I figured I could not return them. Guess I'll make do with some heavy socks. Overall would purchase again but would size 1/2 size down
customer_reviews.author: Mattski

customer_reviews.title: If You Appreciate a Dirty Soul...I Mean Sole
customer_reviews.text: Fit was fine but the two sets of eyelets wasn't enough to feel like they would not fall off. I wear thicker sox when I wear these shoes. Also, the soles of the shoes become dirty quickly and can not be cleaned. I can see why now it is considered rude to show the sole of your shoe to someone. Looks nasty. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mathis

customer_reviews.title: I want to love them, but ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots look cool, and they're quite well made, but they're lacking in the comfort department. Particularly they have ZERO arch support. I installed some cheap foam insoles to soften my step, and they help, but what's really needed is an insole with a little support. Also, when they're tied tightly, the tension doesn't go around to the back of the boot. The tightness occurs around mid foot. So that feels a little odd too. I nearly sent them back. However I decided that, with the foam insoles, they were comfortable enough to keep. Oh, and I wear thicker socks with them too. A must.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: ... reason these shoes are so popular - they're very comfortable and look nice with just about anything
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason these shoes are so popular - they're very comfortable and look nice with just about anything. However, they offer little to no support, so they're a casual boot only. Additionally, the crepe sole discolors very quickly (this is to be expected, but still worth mentioning). Make sure to size down unless you plan on wearing very thick socks, which I don't recommend anyway since they're not very good on ice or snow.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second or third pair of these boots right now. I actually currently have a work pair and a nice pair. They are just simple and sturdy boots that go with pretty much anything. I've really never had a problem with the sole or the upper. The first thing to go always actually seems to be the laces! Buy these with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Martin

customer_reviews.title: leather too stiff
customer_reviews.text: Clarks are known for comfort. The one Clarks shoe I have is the best shoe I have ever owned. I figured this one would be up there as well, and I needed a boot for winter. Well, when tucked under my pant legs, the upper edge of the boot really digs at my skin when walking. The leather is not what you would call soft. It hurts! If I walked a lot I am sure my leg would have chaffing! Not sure what I'm going to do about this--hopefully I can break them in. Aside from this aspect, it is a comfortable shoe. I wish it used softer, more supple leather though. Especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: Glad I listened to them
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these more than any other shoe in the past year. I have a size 10 foot but was sized at a local Clarks store and was told to order a size down. Glad I listened to them! Take that in mind when ordering your pair. But such a great shoe! A staple in my wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend, though don't wear them as you would work ...
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of these so far! I purchased them to wear at work - they fit into our 'semi-casual, semi-business casual' dress code, and they do not dissapoint. They run big, so order a size down! I did not heed this advice, and had to return the shoes. I wear a 9.5, and ended up fitting well into a 9, EVEN with thick socks. They're comfy, and I stand all day at work, and they still fit well. Definitely recommend, though don't wear them as you would work boots - the leather scuffs and dirties easily!
customer_reviews.author: Sean S.

customer_reviews.title: so I love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear these all the time. You can dress them up, or even dress them down. Be careful, because if you're peculiar about creases, if you wear these often enough, you can crease on top of the arch. However, I prefer that crease, so I love the shoe. Affordable, high quality, shipped very well, packaged well, on time, and good for all types of weather!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Handome, comfortable shoe!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very comfortable! They're made of high-quality leather (complete with genuine leather smell) and have a sturdy sole. I bought them as a gift for a friend who is a 10.5. When they arrived, I tried them on. I wear 11, and these were just my size, so I'd advise ordering a half-size down to be safe. I will say, however, that I still gave the 10.5s to my friend, and he finds them comfortable. I don't think you can go wrong here if you like these chukkas. The price on Amazon competes nicely with nearly every other place I shopped.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rice

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes! Try them on before buying
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes, but I would definitely suggest trying them on in person before buy them. I typically wear a Mens US 10.5 or 11 but wear a 9.5 in clarks (which is what the sales people will say too is that they run large). I think they are a nice mix of casual but also a little dressy and could be worn with a lot of things. The beeswax leather is very nice, but if the wear/stress marks bug you then I wouldn't suggest the material.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Iconic Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are my all time favorite shoes. I have had them for over a year, and they look even better now that they are worn and torn than when i initially bought them. They are the most comfortable shoes because they leather is very soft, and the sole is very cushiny. The classy and iconic desert boot style is very stylish. I think for the quality and durability of these shoes, they are completely worth the price. My only complaint is that they run a little big, so I would recommend getting a half size smaller. Mine still are incredibly comfortable even though they have some room. Also, these boots go with everything!
customer_reviews.author: joana pratt

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: This boot in beeswax comes highly recommended, and after purchasing I totally understand. The brown leather works equally well with less dressy denim as with chinos and a blazer. At the sub $100 price point, it's a great beginner boot for people looking to try out the look. I purchased a 10.5 which was very comfortable after about a day of breaking in, no heel slippage or uncomfortable chafing on the sides of my feet. I wear an 11.5 in adidas athletic shoes, for reference.
customer_reviews.author: a burns

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to break these puppies in.
customer_reviews.text: I would give these shoes 5 stars, as they are light, great looking and I definitely feel they will last. The only downside so far is the break in is quite painful if you are not prepared for blisters. This is a no frills real leather shoe and must conform to the shape of your foot. Also I originally ordered a size 11 ( I wear a 9.5 in US size) and it was HUGE. I exchanged that pair for a size 10 and it fits perfectly. I would certainly buy these shoes again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking at these boots for some time now--finally bought them. I wear a size 10 comfortably in Nike, but ordered a size 9.5 in the Clarks because boots typically run larger. They fit really well, they look great, better as they weather, and they're fairly comfortable. My only complaint is that if you do a lot of walking in them they start to rub at your ankle (even with boot socks), and make it a little sore, but other than that small issue, they're awesome and I definitely plan on getting another pair.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: It's odd to think of men's boots as being TOO narrow, but these are! The leather is extremely soft, which can be nice unless you intend to use them as BOOTS. The sole is flat and uncomfortable and little grip is provided on the bottom. These are for strictly indoor settings with no adverse conditions (like an office). If you encounter water, you will die. I'm actually a little insulted that they call these boots. They are more akin to a high cut casual shoe IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: good for every occasion
customer_reviews.text: A staple shoe, good for every occasion. The crepe sole is where is at. I purchased the ones with regular sole and they're very uncomfortable. They don't last very long given the nature of the sole but the beeswax leather is great. Ages beautifully. I have owned like 10 pairs of these.
customer_reviews.author: VDB

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots, but be aware that they run large
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the beeswax leather boot with crepe sole. I love these boots. They look great (immediate compliments from wife) and are super comfy. There are a couple of things that you should be aware of though: 1) They run large. I normally wear a 10.5 on a brannock device, I knew they run a little big so I ordered a 10. That was still a half size too big. I wish I had gone with a 9.5. 2) The sole of the shoe is a crepe sole and will quickly turn black. It's unbelievably comfortable, but if you're concerned about your boots looking clean, I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Shoe; Still Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoes! I gambled on the size as I tried on 7.5 and 8.0 at the local Clarks store and neither fit! I have an older pair size 8.0 that are perfect. I tried these and just as my old ones! Nice comfy cool shoes! About as dressy as I ever get! To help others I'm a size 8.0 on the shoe store scale and wear size 8.0 Converse All Stars. Other shoes vary in size but ordering size 8.0 of these from Amazon fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Aztex

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Manly
customer_reviews.text: The first pair i got were way to small, i ordered a full size down from my usual 12s, These 11.5 fit fine and I'm breaking them in nicely. I will end up purchasing several pair of these i see as they are simple yet sophisticated and can pretty much be paired with many styles and still look great. The craftsmanship is solid and I play to use Shoe Trees with them to keep them dry and also spray 3m water protection on them to keep them even more secure. I do wish they had another eye hole for laces but i guess its just the style.
customer_reviews.author: Twitch.tv/Stubakka

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I've even gotten compliments
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I've even gotten compliments. Look great in most outfits. Only negative is how dirty the crepe soles look after a short amount of time. I didn't think they were that comfortable at first but once I broke them in they're pretty comfortable. I wonder if there's some sealant you can put over new Clark Crepe shoes to keep from dirt ruining their soles.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: i really like the boot,but the quality must need improved
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately,the boot insole has been apart after my first walking two hours .i really like the boot,but the quality must need improved.after contacting with Amazon,the Amazon server is always good,so i accepted the refund 25% and decided looking for fixing.i have bought many shoes from Amazon,the Clarks desert boot was the weakest.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual wear.
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear anything between 11.5 - 12 U.S. Men's. But with Clark's (and most boots) I've always worn an 11. They fit well, like any leather boot, there is a break in period, which according to other reviews people are unaware of...anyway, use a good conditioner like Huberd's, and you'll be more than content with the outcome. These are great causal wear boots, and they are as much at home in the woods, as they are in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mc

customer_reviews.title: Love the Desert Boot
customer_reviews.text: I currently have 86 prs. of shoes but I had no Desert Boots or Chucka Boots. As a very young man I always had a pr. or two. I have seen the Desert Boot being offered by a number of vendors recently. At 72 years old I felt like it was time to add some of these to my shoe closet. I like the cut of this boot and the fact that it was a black boot with a black matching sole and the price was right were I wanted it to be. The fit was true to size as well. They look great with Black corduroy pants and wider bottom denim blue jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Robert Maguire

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pair of shoes; great selection.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking pair of shoes. At first, they seem to be lacking in the arch support. But Clarks are like that. After a while, the foot bed totally conforms to your feet. Unbelievable color choice available here. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: The Clarks desert boots meet all expectations...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy wearing Clarks shoes. My previous pair I had to throw out because, after many years of wearing them, they refused to wear out. What a nice problem to have! These desert boots are very comfortable. I look forward to keeping them and wearing them for a long time. The boots meet my high standards. I gave the boots four stars because I want to wear them a good bit more before I determine they are worthy of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Rod

customer_reviews.title: okay fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm a normal size 13 but Clarks loafers I recently had ran large for me. I opted for size 12 for these desert boots. They fit perfect as far as length. I have large thick toes and wide feet. From above the toe area seems tight, borderline uncomfortable, but I can manage with very thin socks. As far as width they seem fine. These are my first Clarks boots, so maybe they need some break in time? The sole/heel area gets black on the edges but these are meant to be worn so I'm okay with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: transparent rubber that look like gefilte fish or lard
customer_reviews.text: I don't actually know about the arch support. I'm flat-footed. The only complaint I have about these the sole. It is an ugly, transparent rubber that look like gefilte fish or lard. Really unappealing. The shoe fits great. though I wish I hadn't had ventured for the wide size. I thought that would compliment my flat, slightly wide feet, but apparently wide sizes are for people with freakishly wide peds.
customer_reviews.author: Red Wine Kline

customer_reviews.title: Soles wear out fast. Get half soles sewn on right away
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a bit over a year ago. Abouth 11 months in the soles had almost worn through completely. I spent $40 and bought vibram half soles and barge contact cement on Amazon and installed them myself to save these boots. Cobblers wanted $125 for a full resole. Once these finally die i won't purchase Clarks again. Love the look but the soles just wear too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Janney

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy leather - runs short
customer_reviews.text: Displeased as I've owned other pairs of Clark's boots in the past that I liked very much. For what they cost I'm not expecting them to be a ten year boot that I get resoled. I get it, it's a look and brand that you're paying for. That being said, they distressed the moment I put my feet in them. I've had them for a week and there are deep creases and notable wear and thinning where the leather bends with your foot. These won't survive one snowfall - they'll be cracked to hell the moment they get water and/or salt on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the best casual shoes I have ever owned. My first pair I wore for about 8 months out of the year, 4 years straight. And I beat them up--even went hiking in them once or twice. The new pair is just as great as the last--very comfortable and look great. My brother has the "bushacre" from clarks. A very similar shoe but the sole is rubber--not crepe. I prefer the original desert boot. Partly because I'm a sucker for "original" type stuff. But also because the crepe sole is super comfy. A word of warning--they run large. I normally wear a 10, but get a 9.5 in the desert boot.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The shoes I have absolutely no problem with buying!
customer_reviews.text: Clarks are awesome! Their versatility and ability to coordinate with a multitude of looks is fantastic. From casual to dress, put on some Clarks and watch them pull the whole outfit together. They come in a multitude of colors, so you have a lot to choose from. In my experience, they tend to run half a size too larger. I normally wear size 9's, but got 8.5's because the 9's felt a little roomier than I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: enzeru_vs

customer_reviews.title: An excellent shoe. Definitely order a half size down.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent shoe. I would strongly recommend getting a half size down. I wear a size 12 and purchased an 11.5. These fit perfectly. At first, they may seem stiff or even a little tight around the width of the toes, this does however subside after one or two wears. After mine broke in, they became one of the most comfortable pairs of shoes I own. I can wear them all day while standing in the lab and I have very little discomfort. I definitely recommend buying a pair!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing. At first, they weren't the most comfortable, but that's to be expected with any leather boot that takes some breaking in. After breaking in, these are ridiculously comfortable. I could spend all day on my feet in these. They are pretty durable, but I'm a little worried about how long the soles will last. The upper is pretty durable and with leather conditioner I'm sure it'll outlast the soles. These boots look incredible, and go with so many things. They've quickly become my favorite shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, versatile, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: You can buy cheaper desert boots, but these are worth every penny. These are my winter shoes, waterproof for the rain and snow, but dressy enough to wear with a coat and tie. They look great with jeans. I had reservations about the flat sole, but have had plenty of grip so far in the wet. The flat sole makes wiping them off before coming inside a breeze. I think these will last a while, and remain comfortable the whole time. The beeswax finish makes these shoes bulletproof.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Flash

customer_reviews.title: Classic styling, goes with almost any outfit
customer_reviews.text: Classic styling, comfortable fit, and hard wearing - Clarks desert boots are a workhorse in any man's wardrobe. Wear it with jeans, khakis, dress pants, and even shorts if you're feeling hip. These do run LARGE. I normally take a 9.5, but my foot was drowning in my normal size. Had to size down a half size for a better fit. Also worth noting - these shoes last a long time - very durable crepe rubber sole and upper.
customer_reviews.author: The Craftsman

customer_reviews.title: Best boot / shoe I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pair of shoes I could wear casually and at the office. My girlfriend suggested Clarks. I am so glad that I decided to buy these. The second day I wore them I walked for a few miles around the city. That is not something I have ever done in a pair of boots that I was breaking in. They were extremely comfortable and the soft sole makes me feel like I am walking on a cloud. They are the most comfortable boot / shoe that I have ever worn. Get them 1/2 size smaller than you normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: brandon estevez

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the old ones.
customer_reviews.text: I wore Clark's Desert Boots all through college 30 years ago. (We called them engineering boots) They were great shoes, comfortable and durable. When I saw these on sale, I thought I would try them again. These look the same, except smooth leather instead of rough out, but do not seem to be made as well. Maybe I am just more particular than I used to be, but these have no support, the laces are very thin and fragile, and I do not think they will last. However, for $75 they are still a good buy and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: C D Harris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Everyday wear
customer_reviews.text: I have these and the Desert Trek (stitch going up the middle) and they are perfect. These are likely a tad bit more casual as they do not have the stitch, however, they will compliment any outfit. The sole is crepe so it is very comfortable, however, gets dirty pretty fast. I ordered the Beeswax and Black (from another web site) and am happy, very happy. Get them, order a size smaller than your normal size as they run big. I am a size 13 and order a size 12 in all my Clark shoes.
customer_reviews.author: American Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Beats a Classic
customer_reviews.text: I just got into the desert boots in the past year or so but I have always been a fan of classic styling. I absolutely love my DB's! I most recently purchased the beeswax and they are great. Probably my favorite of the three pairs I own. They go with just about everything from jeans to khakis and offer decent comfort at a fair price. Be sure to keep in mind they run a bit big when ordering but YMMV! I normally wear a 10.5 in just about every other shoe I own but all of my DB's are size 10 and they fit great! Every guy should have a pair of these in their wardrobe!
customer_reviews.author: Walter E. Douglas Jr.

product_meta.title: Clarks Originals Men's Desert Boot
product_meta.description:
For a classic that’s graced men’s fashion for over 50 years, check out this Desert boot from Clarks. This chukka features a leather upper with a two-eyelet lace-up for a casual fit. Beneath, a plantation crepe sole delivers legendary cushioning for all-day comfort.

Clarks has been in business for over 100 years making very fine men's dress shoes in a variety of styles. Featuring a wide range of top-quality components, Clarks gives you the options you desire in the quality you demand.
